items.title: [Boing Boing] California is completely drought-free for the first time in 25 years
items.content_html:
For the first time since December 2000, not a single square mile of California is classified as dry on the U.S. Drought Monitor. The last time the state reached this threshold was 25 years ago, the LA Times reports.

A series of powerful winter storms and atmospheric rivers swept across the state starting in October, right on schedule ‚Äî unlike last year. — Read the rest

The post California is completely drought-free for the first time in 25 years appeared first on Boing Boing.

items.title: [Metafilter] She's not going out today because she's too upset
items.content_html:
London, Ontario band MVLL CRIMES is arguing with strangers in the Internet. They also have some career advice.

I saw them open last night for FEAR in Kingston -- which is worth an FPP on its own; lead singer Lee Ving and drummer Spit Stix are still at it in their 70s, and absolutely killing it.

items.title: [Boing Boing] Ireland wants to give police spyware and facial recognition powers
items.content_html:
Ireland is introducing the Communications (Interception and Lawful Access) Bill to modernize its 1993 surveillance laws. The bill would let police intercept all forms of communication, including encrypted messages, deploy spyware with judicial approval, scan electronic devices, and use IMSI catchers to identify suspects, The Register reports. — Read the rest

The post Ireland wants to give police spyware and facial recognition powers appeared first on Boing Boing.

items.content_html: Investors were hoping for Trump to revive the TACO trade after Tuesday's bruising session. On Wednesday, stocks surged as markets got what they wanted.

items.title: [Metafilter] Extraordinary nesting season for endangered freshwater turtle
items.content_html: Extraordinary nesting season for endangered freshwater turtle. A record number of clutches of white-throated snapping turtles have been found along the Burnett River in Queensland's Bundaberg region.

items.title: [iPhone in Canada Blog - Tips, Tricks, News, and Tutorials for Canadian iPhone Users] Hackers Steal 3D CAD Models of Secret Apple Products
items.content_html:
A massive cyberattack on Apple supplier Luxshare has exposed 1TB of data, including secret 3D CAD models, engineering PDFs, and employee information.

The post Hackers Steal 3D CAD Models of Secret Apple Products first appeared on iPhone in Canada.
